meanings.sent1: When I saw the magician make the rabbit disappear, I was dumbfounded.
meanings.sent2: She was dumbfounded by the beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent3: The talking dog left everyone dumbfounded at the park.
meanings.sent4: The news of the alien invasion left the town dumbfounded.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected plot twist in the movie left the audience dumbfounded.

meanings.definition: To be unable to speak due to shock or amazement.
meanings.sent1: The surprise party left her dumbfounded and speechless.
meanings.sent2: He was dumbfounded when he won the lottery.
meanings.sent3: The cat playing the piano left the audience dumbfounded.
meanings.sent4: The sudden appearance of a unicorn in the backyard left the children dumbfounded.
meanings.sent5: The sight of a flying car in the sky left everyone dumbfounded.
